Questions.QuestionText: The iconic Japanese volcano located near Tokyo and known for its symmetrical cone shape.
The peak first summited by Sir Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay in 1953, located on the Nepal–China border.
The highest mountain in Africa, located in northeastern Tanzania near the border with Kenya.
One of the shield volcanoes on Hawaii’s Big Island, holding the record as the largest volcano on Earth.
The mountain in Alaska formerly known as Mount McKinley, standing over 20,000 feet tall.
The active stratovolcano in Washington state’s Cascade Range that experienced a catastrophic eruption in 1980.
The active volcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy, near the city of Catania, known for its frequent lava flows.
The iconic pyramidal peak in the Pennine Alps, near Zermatt, Switzerland.
The second-highest mountain in the world, located on the China–Pakistan border.
The highest mountain in the Andes, located in western Argentina near the Chilean border.
